full_text.full_text:
Generative vs. Discriminative
▪ Generative classifiers
– Describe the underlying distribution that generates the instances 
belonging to every class label (e.g., the naïve Bayes classifier)
• (ex) words in an email → probability of those words generating a spam
▪ Discriminative classifiers
– Directly predict the class labels without explicitly describing the 
distribution of every class label (e.g., decision trees, neural networks)
Discriminative models
Generative models
A generative
model of
every class
7
